page.title: 03Employment in Glastonbury.
page.content: {Modern technology}has meant that there have been{redundancies}in all areas of employment. Many farms have become more mechanised and recent{EEC}dairy quotas have meant that local farmers have had to reduce the size of their herds. Several retail businesses in the town have closed in the recent past and empty shop premises are becoming all too commonplace in the High Street. Many of the workforce found regular employment hitherto in the{boot and {shoe industry}based in the neighbour- town of Street. Two of the town's major employers have been forced to close through financial difficulties. Others have cut their workforce in an attempt to survive. Many people are forced to travel considerable distances each day to their place of employment.
